properties.tip: Red Meadow. Massive meadow to cut with a lawnmower.
Top of Power Lines. Cut enough for access to the Shade Seeker and Tributary Trails.
Clear grassy field by Lovelady for entrance to Hoyle Creek trail.
Anywhere from Lovelady to the start of Tributary Trail, grasses tend to grow up.
An invasive Japenese clover species grows at the start of Clover Creek and along the trail west (left on map) of Clover Creek.
An invasive Japenese clover species grows along the Tributary Trail by Weaver Creek.
Occassional cutting is needed along the Tributary Trail trail closer to the Power Lines.
Occassional cutting is needed along the Hoyle Creek trail.
Hoyle Creek Trail crosses Power lines. Invasive Power Line shrubs need cutting.
The open green needs cutting. A lawnmower is required.
The Table Rock view needs grass cut surrounding the kayak launch.
